intro: Pabstiella velteniana, commonly known as the Velten's pabstiella, is a rare and unique species of flowering plant. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to specific regions in South America. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, woolly leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
